Reviews.Title: “Adequate facilities but location is a bit of a downer!”
Reviews.Author: MeghaChaddah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at one of the ends of Jumeirah Beach and can be accessed only by a cab. The closest metro station is a 10 min drive away and the beach is also a significant walk of close to 20 mins. The hotel however does provide a drop to the beach at a pre determined time. The hotel itself is quite functional but not luxurious which is to be expected as it is an express property. The rooms are quite pretty good, and are equipped with a coffee maker, TV as well as a fridge. Although there are no complimentary drinking water bottles in the room, you could buy them at the hotel itself where it is quite steep or you could just step out of the hotel & pick it up from a grocery store about a minute away. There is a pretty reasonable bar in the hotel and additionally also offers a complimentary breakfast which has a quiet a few options including some traditional Arabic breakfast choices. Although the location can be a bit disappointing as it faces the dry docks (since the address reads Jumeirah Beach, I thought the beach may be a few minutes walk away) and is away from the malls & other tourist attractions the hotel is quite reasonable & moving around is not too difficult in Dubai if you take the cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: FASUAE
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for more than three times when I attend my business meeting the hotel location is good but not the best staff are friendly and breakfast buffet is fine but very Lu Ted choices in it as there is no hot dishes like eggs

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: greg s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as I was attending an exhibition at the nearby Dubai Exhibition Centre, and I like to collect my priotity points so always prefer to stay at a Holiday Inn if i can. I usually stay at Holiday Inn - Al Barsha which is a great hotel, but was fully booked so I opted for this one. The room wasnt overly clean, the sofa was dirty and had crumbs on it and looked like the covers on it needed a wash. There was only one plug-point in the whole room which is completely useless when you have 2 phones to charge, a laptop to charge and and an iron to plug in. The room looked like it needed updated, modernised and given a good clean overall. The bed was comfy and the staff were friendly and organised my wake-up calls and taxis no problems, but at over £100 per night it was far too overpriced, even for Dubai standards. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Valie for money”
Reviews.Author: haigh48
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Holiday Inn Express in Uk as a desperate measure and might not do it again. However for a quick budget visit to Dubai this was prefect. The position The staff The price And it has a reasonable bar too. This one night stay worked so well- quick taxi to Barasti Bar and the night was complete!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel 15 min to the beach”
Reviews.Author: MOHAMED79
Reviews.Content: i always stay there,the rooms was little bit small,the prize are ok,15 min to the beach,opesite the sea,you can found bars and res near bye,the hotal manager mohamed tamarat was fantastic guy who can recommends thigs to do in dubai,the breakfast was fresh and good,i recommened this hotel for familys,but they ask if you are alone or with someone and will ask for ids

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Bluemania26
Reviews.Content: I think it's a very good option if you are planning to stay for a day or two. I think they need more staff to help guests with their bags.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate price for stay”
Reviews.Author: AykutErgezer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days during Arabhealth exhibition Jan. 20-25. Weather was around 20 celcius and no need to coat other than jacket or pullover. It’s very close to Trade Centre and Shopping Malls. Also close to Burj Khalifa which is definitely place to visit. Exhibition period comes also DSF (Dubai Shopping Festival) time so we had sopping with a very affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay, not for families or romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: melissanakhle
Reviews.Content: This was a stay that I would like to forget, we stayed in 2 rooms with our 4 children and still it was very cramped. The rooms very small and crowded even for 2 adults. One bathroom had a broken shower nozzle, towels were not changed and had to ring repeatedly for extra towels. It was also very very noisey. Location very far from all activities and shopping, had to taxi everywhere. So if your on business even then I would think twice3 about staying here. Redeeming point the staff were friendly and generally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean small rooms, but unattractive location”
Reviews.Author: Rose C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night. Arrived very late - midnight - and although there were several front desk staff and no other customers, check-in took forever. Room was clean, but on the smaller size. Bathroom clean and very basic equipped. Breakfast basic, but ok. The hotel is located in a dock/harbour area with nothing interesting nearby. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: saagrawal
Reviews.Content: I was here during new yr time and stayed for 4 nights. I am a platinum member of the priority club and chose this hotel due to proximity to Jumeirah beach and elite membership in priority club. I have a mixed feedback of this hotel. Let me start Good things: 1. Breakfast was quite good, certainly better than holiday inn express hotels in the US! I am a vegetarian and still could manage well for 4 days 2. Fully functional basic hotel, and I didn't experience any difficulty during my stay 3. Front office people are fine, except a few which I will talk in the next section Not so good things: 1. I did not get any benefit of being a platinum member! All the rooms are same so no upgrade, but at least they could have given me corner room (which they didn't); I was told that I will get 'free' newspaper every day which I didn't; and breakfast is anyways free for everyone. So do not expect a special treatment at all. 2. This is a very basic hotel so do not expect any service; no concierge, no room service etc. One night I fell sick and called up reception requesting to send a bottle of water and charge to my room, but the guy refused point blank saying there is no service, and said come downstairs, pay for it and take it to the room! I know that there is no room service but some flexibility should be there! Similarly once I asked for a baisc info, a nearby grocery store but they said there is no conceirge! 3. Its difficult to get taxi from the nearby metro station Room rate during my visit was exorbitantly high so it wasnt a good value for money. However I don't think rates are usually high. Set your expectations properly and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a round trip in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: erikapalla
Reviews.Content: We stay 2 night in this hotel, it was confotable and nice, very good breakfast. It's near from the most important tourist site, but not to go on feet, you can take a common taxi and go around o the city. Dubai seems to be small, but it's an apparence!!!for example the Bury Al Arab is far, but you can take the convenient metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: egie29
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 11 days. We were quite surprised at the courteous, helpful staff and the hotel is conveniently accessible to everywhere. Its a few minutes walk to the popular Al Dhiyafah Street (strip) which is known for good, cheap eats, shopping and watching super-cars being revved up and down the strip. The complimentary breakfast buffet at the hotel was sufficient and the menu rotation was adequate. We definitely will stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djlenzyd2011
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about this hotel and I was happy to see that most of the complaints people had about the hotel had been fixed when I arrived. The rooms were clean and adequate, though rather small. The Complimentary breakfast was quite varied unlike what I'd read in previous reviews The staff were courteous and helpful and eager to assist you. I arrived very early from the airport (around 2am) but I had no trouble getting an early check-in without having to pay for an extra day. You have to pay for many extras, like internet, laundry and items like toothbrush and toothpaste, but this is to be expected at a budget hotel, and I brought my stuff along. The only dark spot I experienced was the distance of the hotel from most parts of down-town Dubai, meaning the best way to get around is by taxi, as the metro is quite far from the hotel. Most fares are about 20 AED though. Overall, I'd say a good hotel, and I may check-in again if I come to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business Trips.. Tourists can give a miss”
Reviews.Author: njaina
Reviews.Content: Before finalizing one, I have sent emails to 4 shortlisted hotels in Dubai and this was only one which responded to my queries. Joella Moore responded to all my queries. So, based on the first impression, I booked this Hotel for my 5 days stay at Dubai. The staff had been very affable and courteous. The breakfast was complimentary and had sufficient choices for vegetarians. However, the location of this Hotel is a drawback for tourists because this is located at Dry Docks and not at Jumeirah Beach Road. Before arrival, I have assumed from the address that it may be near the beach. So, the Hotel does not offer any good view also, there is no market place nearby so we needed a cab to visit any nearby place as walking on the road is almost impossible because of sizzling hot during the day time. The Hotel does not provide any complimentary toiletries or eatables in the room and one will have to purchase everything from the reception. After reaching late in the night, we requested from room delivery of water but we were advised to personally visit the reception and purchase it from there. We had a bad experience about the phone service available in the room. The local call charge as in the tariff card kept in the room was shown as AED 5 for each call but while checking out, it presented a bill of AED 135. On Enquiry, they explained that local call meant a landline call in Dubai and I had called on a Mobile number. Whereas, this information was not provided on the tariff card. So, I felt cheated for this.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: olijayp
Reviews.Content: Good location (near Jumeirah beach), but you'll need a car or have to rely on taxis. Good room, OK breakfast. Basic but good.

Reviews.Title: “Happy birthday to me”
Reviews.Author: ExiledinAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, good quality hotel for a short stay. My birthday took place while I was here and to top off a nice touch I received a birthday card from the hotel which I thought was a fantastic touch. First time this has happened to me while I have been away on my birthday. I thank them from the bottom of my heart for this. Would I stay here again, without a doubt, a big yes.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Jumeirah (Dubai) Review”
Reviews.Author: gmj_ni
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean and tidy.The staff were quite friendly especially the reception and the cleaners.The Meeting Hall was to my expectation but the projector kept going off in the middle of the Seminar I was conducting.A good Audio-Video system would be a good investment for the hotel. Food was good for sure and the spread looked attractive. I was happy to see most low fat foods on the spread. I guess the location near the Dry Docks wasn't suitable for conducting Business Seminars for me personally but to others it might not be the same.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Jumeirah, Ok type”
Reviews.Author: Chalapathi
Reviews.Content: 1) Property & Rooms are good 2) Staff is good 3) Main issues..., no Room Service, not much choice of food in the restaurant, no 24hrs restaurant, if your flight lands late in the night, you can't reach Hotel with empty stomach

Reviews.Title: “Good Holiday Inn value - nothing fancy, but decent”
Reviews.Author: MarkManama
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 6 people (3 doubles) for a 3 day Dubai visit. Location was good for visiting both new and old Dubai, you'll have to take a taxi for the metro or main sites, however taxis are relatively cheap in Dubai. The rooms are not big, but ok for a few days stay where you won't be spending much time in the hotel anyway. Breakfast could've been better, not much variety and could get quite crowded with people queueing (mainly because of the limited space). Staff was helpful, no probs with late check-in. There was some noise next to one of our rooms, I guess that happens, maybe try to avoid rooms with a door between your room and the one next to you. All in all it's what you can expect from Holiday Inn, good value, nothing fancy, but a very decent stay

Reviews.Title: “cheap but a bit far from everything”
Reviews.Author: wolftogo
Reviews.Content: this is a great budget hotel to stay. The shower is great, nice bed and pillows to choose. Breakfast included in room booking which is great and serve fresh fruits and sausages scrambled eggs. Good for budget travellers, but keep in mind need the cost for taxi to get around. Like we were interested in indoor ski and dubai mall which is a bit far from this hotel. Also if you need bottle water. Leave the hotel entrance, turn right, walk two blocks down you get to a local supermarket where you can buy 1.5 litre genuine bottled water for 1.5 dirhams instead of paying 8 dirhams at reception. Great savings!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is very nice”
Reviews.Author: Foddiiii
Reviews.Content: not the best location but all will not matter cause the staff will not spare an effort to please you

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AleemKhokhar
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for seven nights with my family. Hotel is very clean, close to Jumeirah beach and the price is reasonable. They offer free buffet breakfast. Although the choice is not that much but i liked fresh crossiants. They also have underground parking. The only problem with the parking was that if you have a bigger SUV, then its tricky to take it out. Overall, i will rate it excellent and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not the best location. Needs to do better”
Reviews.Author: S G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in October. Overall it was a very nice stay. Our cleaner was brilliant and kept our room spotless. The staff were very friendly however lacked basic knowledge about the surrounding area. For instance, we arrived at 9pm and after we unpacked, wanted to find a restaurant to eat. The receptionist told me the nearest shopping mall was a 10 minute walk up the road, where we would find restaurants available. 20 minutes later and gthe "shopping mall" was the Palm Springs which is essentially a group of boutique shops with a Starbucks and Haagen Dazs. Eventually we ended up getting a taxi to Mall of the Emirates (which is probably the mall furthest away) by taxi as it was the only one I could think of. On another night we had booked a table at the Coconut Grove restaurant which is located in the Rydges Plaza- a 5 min taxi ride from the hotel. We in fact walked back after the meal it was that near. The staff and security had never heard of the hotel and I had to go back to my room to get the address of the Rydges so that they could tell the taxi driver. We were also misinformed about the Big Bus Tour, where is stops in relation to the hotel and where we can buy tickets. A different staff member told me that the bus leaves at 9.30am every 15 mins from down the road that mosque is on. THIS IS ALL INCORRECT INFORMATION!! We walked in the boiling heat to the mosque to find no bus stop anywhere in sight. After a nightmare morning we eventually found the stop was outside Starbucks (on the other side of the street and on an entriel different street!), and the tour started at 9am. HI Express- PLEASE PLEASE train your staff to have the knowledge of these basic things- we wasted a lot of time, money and energy following your information. Our requests were nothing out of the ordinary, and things I would expect a hotel to have plenty of knowledge and information about. Courteous staff is lovely,but they need to have knowledge. Breakfast was ok but the same every day. Milk was warm. We had one drink in the bar and the barman didnt know how to make one of the cocktails (took 15 mins for him to bring drinks over)!! There is no drawer space at all. There were hardly any hangers (though they did bring us more up when we asked). The rooms are small but if you're out most of the day it doesnt really matter. The hotel was very clean and modern. The staff were very friendly and made us feel very welcome. Getting taxis is easy. We walked to the open beach on a couple of occassions (about a 20 min walk in the heat), and there is a Carrefore's just round the corner. Other than that the hotel is a fair way out from the nearest shopping mall, restaurants and metro (Dubai mall- 10-15mins by taxi). Next time I come to Dubai I will stay in a more central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWWWful”
Reviews.Author: Robtex52
Reviews.Content: Here's the good: it was clean, not too expensive, nice front desk staff and had the basics. Here's the bad: the beds were so hard and uncomfortable I couldn't sleep. The pillows were the most narrow I have ever seen. The breakfast was sparse, you had to push your way through to get to anything, and you had to wait in line at least 10 minutes to get a cup of coffee. After my husband had been waiting in line for 10 minutes, and finally got to the front of the line, a man from hotel staff cut in front of him and made him wait 2 more minutes while he got coffee for someone else. We definitely will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pure business hotel”
Reviews.Author: wdalati
Reviews.Content: I had to stay there for three nights during Gitex and I would say that i enjoyed it. The good point goes to the restaurant as it was having nice breakky and the cleaning was very good, you just have to walk away from the table and the team will clean it immediately for the next guest. The room is relatively small but after visiting other hiex properties it not that really bad. The negative point for the hotel was that the 2 in 1 shampoo/body lotion in the bathroom. Did not convince me and it was not pretty much useful. Maybe guys you need to seek alternative options. Hotel has self parking for free for hotel guests which was something appreciated. One last comment, I had a confirmation for smoke free room and at check-in it was not available, I was given smoking room, which needed an air purifier. The view of my room nothing but my neighboring rooms. Anyway I am not on a resort to look at the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Will recommend”
Reviews.Author: san2009
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and were happy to have done so. We have 2 rooms booked and the check-ins were quicky and easy. We were give adjacent rooms with private door between the rooms. The roooms were very clean and well equipped. Beds were nice and comfortable. No issues at all. The Breakfast as good when compared to other HIE properties in cities like London. The location of this hotel is very good. Its close to the public beach and all other places are about 20 AED (max) by Taxi. Cons: Some of the security staff try to hardsell the private taxi tours by directly comparing it with Desert Dreams which the hotel officially works with. I am not sure if the hotel management know about this but they can surely try to stop it. Also the lifts/elevators have a weird smell which was not fixed during the 5 days when we were there. Cleanup of tables in the BF area can also be speeded up if possible. Overall I would recommend this place to fellow travelers...

Reviews.Title: “KEEP AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: veer2808
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to be in Dubai for the weekend, so we looked at the TripAdvisor reviews and did our booking through one of the agencies on the TA site. Our first surprise when checking in was the fact that the room rate charged was much higher than what we had booked at - the reception staff attributed it to taxes and other incidentals. Our room was small, had a musty smell and the furnishings were tacky. Standard items like drinking water, glasses and tissue boxes were not provided. The bathroom had no soap or shampoo, instead there was a hair/ body wash which my wife said made her hair texture oily. The shower knob had no hot or cold markings and needed to be turned clockwise, so one had to be very careful to control the water temperature. When I called Housekeeping to send up some glasses they asked me to call the restaurant which i did. Their response? You guessed it - they asked me to call up Housekeeping. Finally, they sent up two plastic glasses. The hotel is located in a very isolated area of Jumeirah with a "picturesque" view of the dry docks and no restaurants, shopping, activity spots within walking distance. The only attraction is for beach-lovers because the hotel operates a free shuttle service to the nearby Jumeirah beach. Everywhere else, you have to travel by taxi which ranges from 20 AEDs to 60+ AEDs. The hotel security staff try to push private taxis and city tours which we found were were at least 300% costlier when we compared similar tours offered by agencies advertising in the Official Dubai Tourism magazine available free in the room. The one bright spot of our stay was the helpful Filipino staff at the reception who went out of their way to accommodate our request for early check-in and late check-out. Before leaving, we requested for a weighing scale to check our luggage because we were afraid that we may have over-shopped but once again, we were disappointed being informed that this was a 2 star property and such "luxury" items were not available. This was not our first trip to Dubai but it will certainly be our last to Holiday Inn Express, Jumeirah.

Reviews.Title: ““Happy and Will Return””
Reviews.Author: bensuhailis
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit to Holiday Inn Express Jumeirah Beach for one night, friendly and efficient staff, Check in was a breeze, Lovely Hotel superb Staff all friendly and very helpful, Location was good I must mention one of the staff at the hotel was Liz (reception) she give nice room it was 605, its very spacious room..... and Christine (restaurant) start the day with simple breakfast both of them was just so helpful and the customer service they presented was excellent. I just like to say thank you to you both, please keep it up.... Best wishes, Alius Ben Suhailis

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Olga2410
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one week. Very easy to get from hotel to Jumeirah open beach, around 15 minutes by walking or 3 min driving. Starbucks is 15 min walking as well. If you wanna go to Dubai Mall - around 15 min by driving. Hotel provides a complimentary transfer to Dubai Outlet Mall. You have to pay the deposit upon check in of total amount 100$. Breakfast was ok, you don't need to expect smth very special in 2 stars hotel. It is a great hotel for minimum money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Lenka5
Reviews.Content: Important for us was to find cheap hotel close to the beach and not so far from the airport. I think this was the best place. It was very nice and clean hotel. It was rated as a 2* hotel, but I would rate it even 4*. Rooms were always clan. There was a nice gym on the 1st floor, which you could use. Breakfast were always the same, but it was ok, we alwyas found something good to eat. There is shuttle service to Jumeriah Beach, which will take you there and back for free. Close to the hotel are many shops with the food and also clothes and of course restaurants. The bus stop is about 5 -10 min by walk. If I would come there once again, I would definatelly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Mohi_Khater
Reviews.Content: I stayed several times for business meetings. The hotel is 2 stars but service and facilities are for 3 stars. Basically the hotel is the best express hotel out of the 4 express properties in Dubai. Tried several rooms and all of them are spacious. Breakfast was poor. I was expecting more items. However, this is the express standard generally. The bas was simple and we liked it. Gym was clean and they have shuttle service to Jumeriah Beach Park. Great option for business travelers and for quick overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomf104
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Dubai late and just needed a place until I checked into Crown Plaza the next day. Room was nice, nothing fancy but more than adequate. After being in Afghanistan for six months I needed a hotel with a bar and the Holiday Inn Express had one so it fit the bill. The beer was cold but the nachos were not like nachos I am used to but edible. The continental breakfast buffet was standard fare with the option to order additional menu items if desired. Although this was by all means adequate I will probably stay at the Holiday Inn Express Airport next time to eliminate the extra drive time but overall this was a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice n Easy, Friendly & inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: GoodCompanion
Reviews.Content: Budget Hotel with no frills, close to trade center for exhibitions/conferences only 15 minutes drive. Courteous and friendly staff, basic free buffet breakfast, Lunch at AED 39 and a bar with inexpensive drinks..!!! Wifi Internet only available in Lobby area and is paid. Good for business travellers on budget... The view is of the Dry Docks which is not very pleasant.. however the sleep is quiet n peaceful. There is no bellboy or Room Service.. however you can buy your drinks/snacks from the kiosk. The House keeping was slow needed few calls before they turned up.

Reviews.Title: “4 star at 2 star rates”
Reviews.Author: earth69
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this hotel while searching for hotels close to the beach...after reading reviews on tripadvisor I decided to book the hotel as it was meeting all my requirements of being close to beach as well as mina bazaar. I went with lot of expectations & I wasnt disappointed : ) at around 2K for a night...its one of the best budget options I feel...though I havent seen much around... but saying this after spending 2 nights. the service can be better I feel..but one cant get everything, so ok.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: petroleatomic
Reviews.Content: The service is quiet good and people careful, The Twin beds room are a bit small for a long stay as I had. The Room are noisy between the coridor having the cleaning team aroun and the doors opens on rooms you can hear your neighbour nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable rates and close proximity to the Mina Bazaars, Al Karama and Deira City”
Reviews.Author: Imtiaz_ctn
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for affordable accomodation in Dubai, then give this place a chance. It is located far from the top hotels, but is well serviced by taxis and is close to the shopping malls. Once at a mall use the monorail to get around. The bell boys / security guys are also able to provide good options with transport and tours. Rooms are clean and well serviced. Breakfast is basic but good.

Reviews.Title: “horrible place”
Reviews.Author: Gaukhar22
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to this hotel the chek in was fast and welcom(in the late evening). I asked to make up the sofa for my son as soon as it possible, because of he is very tired after long trip. The teapot, phone in the room and internet plug did not work and nobody did not come after 20 min of waiting. I came down to the reception 3 times with this problems and only on 4 time somebody from the staff came to my room. The room was small and not fresh,there for there is very uncomfortable and bad quality shower gel which is located very high in the bath cabine. The brekfast is very poor, restaurant is too small and crowdy at the brekfast time. We left this hotel in a hurry ( moved to another hotel) and my daugter forgot her Iphone4 in the room next to the bed (for shure), I called to the reception 3-4 times to check the room very carefully but nobody "find" and returned to us her mobile. She was very disappointed because of it was a gift for her 7 years.... birthday

Reviews.Title: “Very Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Dubai97
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at this hotel, we booked it online, but were unaware of its exact location. The location is a little far away from centre of Dubai. The hotel staff is very nosy and so are the security guards. The security guards kept on pushing us to take private taxis from them, which are VERY EXPENSIVE and they kept on giving unwatnted suggestions regarding things like desert safaris, etc. Even though you tell them no.. that you are not interested they still won't leave u alone, I guess just to make money off the guests. The rooms were not properly equipped with daily toiletteries, also no bottles of water were provided, and everytime and you would ask for something from housekeeping they would get upset and question you why do you need that item?.. and they would take atleast half an hour to bring the item to your room, that too sometimes you had to call them atleast 3-4 times. In this world where Internet is so common, this hotel charges for it and that too at a very expensive rate. We thought that the internet is free when we booked it, because it said so on their website, but it was not. The tv is ages old, not up to date. The managers are not aware of their processes and do not have good customer service. Overall, all the hotel staff .. from management to the security guards need some customer service training and need to mind their own business.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: pleasure721
Reviews.Content: very clean and friendly hotel, the staff is very friendly, especialy the reception guy from morocco

Reviews.Title: “BRING DRINKING WATER BEFORE REACHING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SHAHGujarat
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfect except they are not providing drinking water bottle free of cost and charges AED 8 or 9 per bottle of 1.5 ltr while the same in available in next door step mini super market at AED 1.5. Breakfast only continental type so INDIANS , be ensure either you have developed the taste or take some food packets from the market

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money !!!”
Reviews.Author: boutondargent
Reviews.Content: I have spent four nights in this Holiday Inn Express, which I would not name "Express" because its services are really superior to other Holiday Inn Express in other countries. Room, cleanliness of the hotel, breakfast, lunch and buffet dinner ( good-tasting food at a very fair price), services, quality of the supplies and amenities provided in the room and bathroom make me rate my overall stay as "excellent". The taxi from the airport costs around 40-50 dirhams. There is a shuttle to the shopping "Mercato" and in the evening to another shopping mall; the hotel provides a shuttle service to the beach (very nice and clean beach); I had a small issue with the driver who made me wait at the beach for 15 minutes; on my return to the hotel, I contacted immediately the Management, the problem was handled by the young lady Manager of the hotel who solved the issue exceeding my expectations. In general the staff is very helpful and efficient, the hotel offered evrything I needed, I would definitely recommend it to others. Although I do stay very seldom in HI express, but usually in other IHG hotels, I must confess that this time I was very positively impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value holiday inn express - perfect if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: charlie_dog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst on a 3 day budget trip to Dubai and Abu Dhabi. I had a car so the location was not an issue. I have used this hotel previously and its good value for money for Dubai. You should remember its a holiday inn express and not a 5 star hotel. The rate I got was very reasonable. The hotel is located near the dockyards area and the views are not fantastic. However, there is a free underground car park, free breakfast and a supermarket within walking distance. There is also a TGI FRidays within walking distance ( left out the hotel cross the road and keep walking its on your right 15mins walk or a few pounds in a taxi). You can also get a taxi to go to the nearby Jumeirah beach park, great beach, park and a hidden gem at £1 entrance with places to eat in here too. I would estimate this at 30 mins walk or 15 Dhs in a taxi. The breakfast was a bit crazy but it was a weekend and its a HI express. The staff tried their best though. The check in staff were not the friendliest HI staff I have ever come across.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel - just a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: JaneofArabia
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was simple but clean and the rooms were very tidy with new beds and linen. Everything was in good working order. The breakfast, even though it was only continental, was quite extensive with breads, pastries, cheeses, cereal, yoghurts and salad. The staff were nice, everything in the hotel was reasonably new. The bathrooms were nice enough and very clean. The rooms were very quiet even though we were on a reasonably busy road and there didn't seem to be any noise in the hotel either. The only two things I didn't like were that the room smelt strange - particularly the linen smelt like it hadn't been properly dry when it was folded and so had a sort of a mildewy smell. It looked spotless - it just had a very strange aroma. Also the hotel is not near anything. There's no easy public transport and it's not walking distance to anything so we spent quite a bit of money and time in taxis. The hotel overlooked the drydocks which wasn't really a problem if, like us, you were only in the hotel to sleep, but it wouldn't have been the nicest place for a romantic minibreak. Calling the area Jumierah was a bit of a stretch too - Jumeirah itself is a bit of a way away.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: JMGeneva
Reviews.Content: Although not vy large, rooms are surprinsingly good and the staff is both efficient and helpful. A god choice for a very reasonable price. On the down side, the location is not optimal, but given the very cheap price of cabs in Dubai this is not really a problem. Breakfast is average... But included in most of the diverse "plans" offered by the hotel (I chose one with breakfast and free un,united Internet for just a couple more dollars than the room alone, good deal). Comfortable, no frills, efficient.

Reviews.Title: “not my favorite location”
Reviews.Author: afinanika
Reviews.Content: We used metro which was not good to use from this hotel. is close to centre which is good if you drive a car. Hotel is nothing special, rooms was smaller that usual which surprised me , no free internet, and cable in room didn't work, had to use wifi in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: traveller3530
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night , usually stay at another Hi's in Dubai but thought of trying it for a night, as its a express i knew what to expect, check in was smooth stay was not bad, knew the location, if you are driving its quite a good location, Problem was when i checked out, while checking out even though i had cleared my complete amount while checking in i was told to wait, while the person on the counter was attending another guest , he was more like chit chatting and made 3 people wait, which was schoking, i had to wait over 20 minutes for nothing, i had to go to him and tell him that i am a platinium member for him to do some work his name was Mr SYouness, and moreover he dint offer me a bill when i asked him he dint give an envelope!!!!, never experienced such a horrible experince. disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Best 2 star hotel I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: witchhansolo
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel since it was very close to the beach area. The hotel was 2 stars but it was very clean, very good decorated that you forget that you stay in a 2 star because the bed and the room was perfect. The room was cleaned everyday although we did not ask for a change for our towels everyday, they were changed. the number of TV channels were enough and they were international. The breakfast was also good and enough in type of food served. The restaurant was small but it was comfortable and clean. Only thing I did not like is you cannot open the windows but maybe it is because of the climate. Sİnce Dubai is a very hot city especially in summer, there are air conditioners everywhere so to get the best result windows should not be opened. So maybe this is the reason that windows were closed. We stayed with our kid. it was also convenient for the 3 of us. So I recommend this hotel for families with small kid or baby (since there are not 3 beds) and also for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good base for exploring Dubai”
Reviews.Author: David Lee
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here as part of a week exploring UEA. Its a friendly and efficient hotel. Rooms are comparatively higher standard than comparable Holiday Inn Express hotels in the UK, with very comfortable beds, fridge and digital safe in the room, overall feeling more like a Holiday Inn than the Express brand. Overall tasteful, peaceful and restful decor and includes kettles tea/coffee in the room. The bathroom was good, and now there are soap/shower gel dispensers both at the sink and in the shower (previous reviewers have commented these were missing when they visited). Breakfast included bread/toast olives, yogurt, grapefuit, pastries cereals and fresh fruit - all in all fine. It got quite crowded when we were there on one morning - the biggest bottleneck being the tea/coffee machine - only one of these so there could be a lengthy queue at times. But go early and there's no problem. We tried the evening buffet one night and were pleasantly surprised - a good and tasty range of salads, about 5 hot dishes, and fruit salad, cream puddings, banana fritters etc - all for 60 AED per person. Very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is about 10-15 minute bus ride from the Al Ghubaiba bus station (the terminal for buses to/from Abu Dhabi) in central "Old Dubai" on the No 8 bus (runs every 20 minutes both ways), with the bus stop about 300 metres from the hotel. So getting to the Creek, Souks, Dubai Museum is very easy. The No 8 bus also goes, in the other direction, all along Jumeirah beach road, so easy to get to the beach and look at the Burj al Arab and other big hotels. Dubai is though a very spread out city and unless you get a taxi it means quite a long walk (30 mins) to the nearest Metro station if you want to get easily to the newer sights around Dubai Mall etc. Overall connectivity between the buses and Metro is not good so we ended up walking quite a lot. While during the day it was hot, at night time it was atmospheric enough, taking us into non touristy areas, and busy areas with quite good local restaurants (nearest of these about 15 minute walk from the hotel). The immediate vicinity of the hotel overlooks the dry docks, and there is office/restaurant development going on nearby. Despite this hotel not being in the centre of things, we got the impression very few hotels we saw in Dubai could be described as ideally located for public transport - hopefully something Dubai will get right in future. So this was a relaxing base, excellent value and certainly well connected for the old town/Creek area.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money but still think before checking in”
Reviews.Author: Manojkateja
Reviews.Content: Dear All, Its a good value for money in a city like dubai but be careful as it dont have much luxury as holiday inn is suppose to give you, over all it a good experience but rooms are small only for singles not really for couples or family, Breakfast was horrible it dont have much vareity and secondly the place is really far from city, u cant get taxi easily. have to wait for the taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: solewalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights - it is not in the best location, and there was nothing around here, but the rooms (though small) were very comfortable, and we had a good breakfast. It was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Room is good but small and I had a bad experiance”
Reviews.Author: aappy
Reviews.Content: I booked the room by online and it was for accomodating two persons in one room. I paid the bill amount for one night against one bill after the check-out . Later I have noticed that they are deducted double amount from my credit card seperately for me and my spouce. I am not receive any updates from them on I contacted the customer care in Holiday Inn Website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some letdowns when compare to a normal HI Express”
Reviews.Author: can99
Reviews.Content: OK hotel, but not a normal HI express if you have used them in the rest of the world. The bad; - No soap in bathroom at all (that is strange for any hotel) - Checkin policy of wanting whole amount up front plus more even for credit card payment! - Internet far too expensive (AED 20 -1hr, AED 30 - 2hrs, AED 100 for a day, AED 450 a week), its fast but not free like most all HI Express worldwide. - Breakfast, no hot item like a normal HI Express (no omelettes, or eggs, or the trade mark hot cinnamon rolls), rest of breakfast is boring, just bread, small croissants, apples, oranges sometimes banana, flavored yogurt, plain yoghurt, 4 cereals, slice cheese and slices of grapefruit, 2 types of juice), pretty basic overall. - No free water given like most all hotels worldwide give in the bathrooms, or even on checkin some HI's hand you a couple of bottles. - Doors are paper thin, and lots of dock workers stay here, the only time you hear them is at 0630 when they leave The GOOD - Cheap price - New hotel - Cleanliness or whole hotel is great - Has a restaurant (rare in a HI Express) - Has a bar (very rare in a HI Express) - Location, 10 min walk to the beach, or shops, starbucks, TGI Fridays, nightclub at the Marina etc, 15 min drive to almost anywhere. - Front desk, Reservations and Housekeeping staff are friendly and helpful, the restaurant staff need some motivation and to learn to at least pretend to be happy! - Free parking (rent a car at the airport, great way to get around and driving is easy) - Taxis are easy to get, hotel has a shuttle which will at least get you one way free. Like all hotels in Dubai, there is no perfect location they are either attached to a mall or in the middle of nothing, this one is nearly in the middle of nothing, but you have to consider that all of Dubai is one big building lot!

Reviews.Title: “HIEX Continue To Get It Right”
Reviews.Author: dbconstruct
Reviews.Content: thankyou once again to jumeirah staff and management for a great stay as normal - shame it was so short - had time to nip down the road to a sister hotel in knowledge village to sample the delights of VISTA - a new menu - presentation and taste of the food was second to none - a real treat - service, staff and management - excellent - hope to see you all again soon - David.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, just don't expect a great view..”
Reviews.Author: Sabah_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Holiday Inn Express Jumeirah for a week with my mother due to its great value! It certainly didn't disappoint. The hotel staff are very friendly and rooms kept clean. Although I had known the hotel is built to the side of the dry docks I didn't expect the view outside to be directly of this - the sea was barely visible from our room. As with many other reviews - the breakfast could be improved with a hot option preferably eggs, as by the end of the week we had tired from the same breakfast over and over. The location of the hotel is not bad at all - 10minutes walk from Al Dhiyafa Rd where we found ourselves for dinner every other night. Jumeirah mosque is also nearby, a 15minute walk down the road and Starbucks opposite - although it's probably more convenient to grab a taxi in the heat of the daytime. The hotel amenities were good too, offering a shuttle service to and from Jumeirah beach and Dubai Mall which is very convenient - however, they should operate this at several times during the day. The room conveniently had tea/coffee to sip after a long day but didn't have any cold drinks in the fridge, when most hotels do. There was also a clean gym and a separate prayer room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: asitisBahrain
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel close (10 minutes walk) to restaurants and shops. Rooms clean and in good condition. Breakfast would be improved by an additional hot option (scrambled eggs?)

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Crzy_Diamond
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel and did appreciate it, very nice and clean small room and comfortable bed. It was worth the budget fare that I paid. The only thing is the location, there's almost nothing around the hotel, but 5mn taxi ride will get you to Jumeirah road with plenty of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The Excellant hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: MemarHadi
Reviews.Content: the best hotel that stayed in Dubai.frendly staff from the front desk to all other departments.l service and cleanness and the location is very comfatable for evrithing. my wife and l felt this hotel like my home and a super star hotel for this few days that l spent.l will not hesitate to recomnd this hotel to anybody who wants to have a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Bulldog01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerours hotels in Dubai over the years, from expensive through to cheap. As an option in the middle this hotel was excellent value offering clean and tidy rooms with a great laundry service, tea and coffee facilities in the rooms, TV and a good bathroom en suite. The staff were all very helpfull and welcoming. Its in a great location for the Dry Docks and city. only about 15 minutes from the airport. Well done I say to all staff who made my stay enjoyable. Very good value for money plus a complimentary buffet continental breakfast and free on site parking.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Willis68
Reviews.Content: I accidentally booked into this hotel on-line. I meant to book into the Holiday Inn Al Barsha which is great but somehow took my eye of the ball and stupidly booked into this place. It has NOTHING to recommend it at all. The rooms are basic and small and do not even have a bottle of water in them! It was midnight and I had been on a long flight and I was told if I wanted water I would have to buy from the kiosk in the lobby. The surfaces in the room were dirty, the road outside is noisy, internet expensive, the breakfast more than minimal - I could go on but I won't. In summary, don't.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service, location could be better”
Reviews.Author: ehan16
Reviews.Content: Visited dubai with my family for the new year. Wanted to book an apartment at the Symphony Hotel apartments but ther was no availability for the 1st 2 days of our stay. Chose Holiday Inn Express Jumeira for those 2 days. Were confident bcoz have previously stayed at Holiday Inns around the world & have always liked it. This hotel didnt disappoint either. I agree with other reviewers that the location could be better. The area is a bbusiness area, but since it was New year & peak season, the hotel was full with families. Excellent ambience. Cosy albeit lil small rooms. The bathing water could have been hotter. Tho other ppl have complained about the breakfast, i think it was ok. Tea/coffee thru a coffee making machine, choice between 2 juices, 3 varities of fruits, brown & white bread slices, excellent croissants, choice of 4 cereals. If they add just 1-2 hot items, breakfast will be perfect. I must mention that this breakfast, tho simple, was far superior to what was laid out the Symphony Hotel (read my review). The staff were always smiling & ready to help. Service was good. All in all, we would readily stay ther again.

Reviews.Title: “The best for this Budget”
Reviews.Author: Atef220
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 3 nights in December 2009. its very nice hotel but with some disadvantages : - No room service - we reserved a shuttle limousine to pick us from airport and they didnt send But overall its the best you can get for this budget "amazing rate about 86 USD /night through hotel website" with good location Perfect if you go there for business and looking for low budget

Reviews.Title: “If you're on a budget, here's your choice”
Reviews.Author: tripdreamer1975
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. I repeat, excellent value for money. Brand new hotel, with all the needed facilities and amenities, close to the main attractions. Do not expect Jumeirah beach, but for $50 it will do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: NAKIBOI
Reviews.Content: We live in the UAE and only wanted the room for the night to pick family up from the airport. We were welcomed with smiles and friendly joking staff who quickly processed our booking and sent us to our room. the room was very tidy, clean and modern It had a pull-out couch that we were going to use but our 3yr old had other ideas. Breakfast was great, it is stated it is contnential, we were more than satisfied with what was on offer. Had to pay and extra 20% taxes but we were also aware of that from looking into the booking. Area is near the port but is a short (4km) walk to a great mall, Mercarto, and beach is also near here.Excellent choice of cafes and resturants about 2km walk. Overall it is exactly what we wanted, we only slept there and were out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Hungry at Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TheKumarsInDubai
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms (they should remove the huge cabinet-almirah-table, makes the small room even smaller) Good value for money, relatively new fittings etc. Already knew there's no room service, so we were prepared for that Complimentary Breakfast was very disappointing, buffet doesn't have eggs! Should have an option where people can atleast get a hearty breakfast by paying for it View out of the window is of construction at the dry docks, so dont expect jumeirah to mean jumeirah beach

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you book ahead.”
Reviews.Author: freezing_again
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Dubai for an interview and to catch up with old friends for a week. Directions provided by Holiday Inn were probably accurate but useless for a new arrival unfamilar with the city and driving a rental. Not their fault. If driving yourself, pay the extra and get the GPS (Satnav) with your car. Once you learn a few landmarks, the hotel location is easy to remember. Security was helpful and pleasant. They met me as I parked the car and delivered my luggage to the room. They're also quick to hail a cab for you if needed. Checkin was painless and within minutes my head was comfortably resting in bed. The room was small but adequate. Compared to stateside Holiday Inn's you're getting more for your money. Be sure to book your stay in advance. Witnessed two men at the front desk requesting the internet rates without success. They paid about 50% more. Breakfast is buffet style with few choices but adequate. Only ate here on the first day. Excellent food awaits you elsewhere in the city. The business center and internet access is adequate but pricey. The one shortcoming was their ability to provide copies. Either the copier was acting up as the desk clerk claimed or she didn't know how to operate it. Needed copies of identification for my interview and the ones she handed me were completely unuseable. Each copy was 3DHS, little less than a buck. The bar is now up and running but extrememly expensive even compared to trendy expat bars on the beach. Travel with cash and exchange for DHS at the airport. Exchange rate at this hotel will net you almost 10% fewer DHS for your dollar. Great place to lay your head at at very reasonable rate. Hopefully, you'll spend 90% of your time exploring Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and good location”
Reviews.Author: khalid606
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best 3 stars hotels I ever stayed in Dubai It’s new (open 2008), and very clean. The rooms are spacious, and have good amenities (coffee/ tea making tray, refrigerator, TV, safe box, etc.) The location is good, nice neighborhood, a lot of restaurants near the hotel. The hotel also provides free car parking in the basement for gusts. The only disadvantage of the hotel is that the internet is too expensive (almost 25$ a day).

Reviews.Title: “Good but the location is not so good”
Reviews.Author: Wagner_A
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn always has a good price. The Holiday Inn Express Jumeirah is a real business hotel. The room has the minimum to your stay: shower, shampoo, towels, cable TV with minimum pay channels, cabled payed Internet, single or double bed. The breakfast is very very simple. It doesn´t have any meat and derivative products like: tender, sausage, etc. 3 types of fruits: banana, orange and grapefruit. The location is far from main atracttions like: Burj al Arab, The Creek and Shopping Malls. Except the Jumeirah Mosque(walking 5 min). I recommend the City Tour "Big Bus". The ticket for 24h is 220 dirhans(about U$60) including a 1h boat trip in the Creek and museuns tickets. It stops in all main atractions including main Shopping Malls.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean, modern and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lescullens
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes from the airport, which is ideal for an inbound late night flight. Breakfast was substantial with a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the can..”
Reviews.Author: acjkt
Reviews.Content: If you need somewhere in Dubai that is fairly reasonably priced (there are cheaper options in less selubrious surroundings) and is just somewhere to stay without all the trimmings then this is a good choice. Check in was fairly straightforward after a little confusion about the booking from the travel agents but that has happened before so I wasn't overly concerned. The room is on the small side but is clean and has the basics, the internet was a bit hit and miss and was quite expensive AED20 per hour but was enough to download my emails. I was surprised they didn't even supply one bottle of complimentary water (they told me the water is drinkable - I didn't chance it!), however there is a small kiosk selling drinks and snacks at reception. There is a free shuttle to the beach and Dubai Mall several times a day, although it's easier to take taxis which are readily available on the street - just ask the Front Desk or go and flag one down, it costs aound AED40 from the airport and AED25 to the airport and AED15 to most other local destinations. Breakfast is complimentary, and to be honest shouldn't be charged for as it is so basic, just toast, rolls, cereal, juice and coffee, nothing hot and very little choice but that's not the business model they are looking for. I'd happily stay here again as it's functional and the money I save can be spent on other things in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a longer stay”
Reviews.Author: FreeMind
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for an one-night stay through the Intercontinental website. The location not so so far from the airport, 10-15 min, 50 AED. Also Deira within 10 min by taxi. There are some smaller shopping centers nearby - at a walking distance - but the hotel itself next to docks and building sites. The room was the smallest we have seen in Dubai but new, clean and functional. Breakfast very basic and does not meet Holiday Express standards elsewhere, no meat, no vegetables, some fruit. At 11:20 a staff member called us in the room to remind the check-out time being at noon. A bit irritating if you are a frequent traveler and a Priority Club Gold card holder. We know the basics! Otherwise the reception staff very service-minded and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Designers
Reviews.Content: Very clean, helpfull staff location not far from Jumeriah Road and open beach, plus free breakfast, if you looking for a bargain hotel, with no frills, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect 5* luxury, but a great base from which to experience Dubai on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren-Eleanor
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend staying here if you’re looking to explore Dubai without breaking the bank. My friend and I (females in our twenties looking for a fun week away) stayed here in February and had an excellent time. The hotel staff, particularly security and in the restaurant, were extremely pleasant and polite and made us feel very welcome. The rooms were similar to any other Holiday Inn Express around the world that I have stayed in, reasonably comfortable with basic facilities (no room service/mini bar though.) Breakfast is buffet style with a range of options, croissants, pastries, toast, cold meats & cheese as well as fruit, yoghurt and cereal. Should you wish to, you can pay extra to order a cooked breakfast. The hotel seems to be orientated towards businesss trips and stopovers as it is fairly close to the airport (about 15 minutes drive) but I would definitely also recommend it to other holiday makers as it is great value for a first time exploring Dubai. It takes about 30 minutes to get to the centre of Dubai, where the majority of hotel bars/clubs & restaurants are based and about 20 minutes to the Burj Al Arab/Jumeirah Beach hotel area (where the Wild Wadi water park and lots of the other restaurants and bars are located.) Despite this, it is very cheap in a taxi for the amount of time you spend driving (at the very most 10 pounds to get into the centre of Dubai.) It would have been nice to be a little more central as it took quite a large chunk out of the day should we go back and forth from the hotel back into the centre of town. However, we spent most of our time on the beaches in the centre of Dubai, when there is in fact a beach that is 15 minutes walk from the hotel itself, so if you wish simply to visit the beach during the day, then this will considerably cut down your travel time. Despite being on the main road leading out of Dubai, a few taxi drivers didn’t know where the hotel was, so if they don’t, nearby points of reference that we found helpful when explaining where we wanted to go to were the flag (virtually opposite the hotel), the dry docks and the fact that the hotel is in Jumeirah 1. We had a few minor complaints but all in all the price of the hotel far outweighed them. The first was the fact that on arrival we were told that we must put down a deposit of 1000dh each (currently about 100 pounds) in cash and were unable to leave our credit card details instead. We were unhappy to pay this on arrival, particularly as it had not been advertised in advance and we did not wish to be left with such a large amount of foreign currency in cash which we would be unable to spend being left with it on our last day in Dubai. Therefore, we eventually agreed with the receptionist to leave a smaller amount of 100dh each (approx 20 pounds currently) which I would definitely recommend to do if you do not wish to be left with lots of cash to change back on your return home (should you not use it up in additional room costs.) There is no swimming pool, which is a shame in such a hot country and also being near a beach it would have been nice to have a balcony (if only to use to dry towels.) However, these are minor complaints and generally the Holiday Inn Express provided us with a great location from which to explore the rest of Dubai. Don't expect 5* luxury, but a great base from which to experience Dubai on a budget!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Dubai Jumeirah
HotelInfo.Address: Corner Of Jumeirah Road and 60 Road | Al Mina, Jumeirah, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
